data.description:
# The Ecofrontiers Regen Atlas üå±

## TLDR ‚ú®

[Ecofrontiers](https://ecofrontiers.xyz/) is a Web3 research and advocacy program to unlock the value of nature. Next to the writing of a book on the production of tokenized natural capital, Ecofrontiers has incubated **the Regen Atlas** (prev. the Ecofrontiers Map), an open-source platform designed to facilitate displaying, funding, and incubating of natural capital projects through a user-friendly, interactive map interface. 

**With this GG20 round, Ecofrontiers announces the release of a [new sample chapter](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/z53KLf1agwjNSQrAY78Zg4qm9-FYZB2Yh3TDj3ojIRM) of the Green Crypto Handbook, as well as a [new prototype](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/) of the Regen Atlas.**

## Vision üåç

The Regen Atlas is set to transform this landscape by providing a global, open-source platform on Celo for individuals and organizations to support or invest in environmental projects, equipped with detailed ratings for various green assets. This initiative not only diversifies the focus beyond carbon offsets to include other green assets like biodiversity and water purification but also introduces innovative financial instruments such as green bonds and nature-backed currencies.

## Solution ü´°

**APPLICATION: The Regen Atlas** üó∫Ô∏è
[The Regen Atlas](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/) is a location-based aggregation layer enabling the discovery, trade, and creation of tokenized green assets throughout the globe.
With the Regen Atlas, we propose an alternative to the current state of the decentralized green asset market, where:
* Projects tokenizing natural capital are in need of a clear and intuitive platform to display the location of their assets.
* Organizations, governments and individuals willing to buy tokenized natural capital are in need of a unified interface enabling asset discovery beyond carbon.
* Environmental projects aiming to tokenize natural capital are in need of a platform to show where they are operating and advertise their project.

The Atlas‚Äô key features include:
**Support for Diverse Green Assets**: The Regen Atlas accommodates a wide array of green crypto-assets, covering various environmental categories that go beyond carbon. Users can explore and engage with projects related to carbon assets, but also non-carbon ecosystem services (e.g. biodiversity, regenerative agriculture, water purification), green and blue bonds, forwards contracts, and more. The interface has a filtering feature, enabling hassle-free browsing and funding. 
**Aggregated Ratings Agencies**: To provide users with valuable insights, the Regen Atlas is working towards aggregating scores from ratings agencies specializing in natural capital. This consolidated resource will offer a bird's eye view of the highest quality initiatives, helping potential funders make informed decisions while building their green portfolio. This round will help fund this feature.
**Top-down Territorial Incentives (longer term, outside the scope of this round)**: The Regen Atlas lets users create incentives in relation to extant territories, helping stimulate natural capital projects in areas where they can have the most significant impact. Users eager to incentivize the production of natural capital assets will be able to pin a location on the map and enter specific tender information‚Äîsuch as the incentive offered, e.g. a carbon credit‚Äîbefore publishing their request for proposals.
**Support for Existing Green Assets (longer term, outside the scope of this round)**: Many green assets already exist, but lack the global accessibility afforded by public blockchains. The interface will allow users to request these assets as tokens on Celo, partnering with well-regulated, designated RWA providers.
**BOOK: The Green Crypto Handbook** üìñ
*The Green Crypto Handbook* is a book project offering an insightful preview into the *how* of environmental finance. The text explores what we call the *Environmental Finance Stack*, a six-layer framework aimed at enhancing the generation of natural capital assets. This structured methodology spans from the tangible, real-world environment to the dynamic markets where these assets find their trade. The handbook serves as a comprehensive guide, dedicating each chapter as a deep dive into each layer's significance and operation. 
## What has been done since the last round üßë‚Äçüíª

**The Regen Atlas**

Since our last update, the team has made significant progress on the [Regen Atlas prototype](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/), evolving it into a more refined and user-friendly version. We transitioned to a Version 2, which features a visually appealing design and enhanced user interface, making navigation and interaction with the platform more intuitive. Among the key improvements:

1. **Enhanced Design and UI**: The interface has been overhauled for better usability and aesthetic appeal.
2. **Advanced Filtering Options**: Users can now filter assets not just by their type and issuer, as before, but also by subtypes and location, allowing for a more granular search experience.
3. **Asset Addition Feature**: A new "add asset" function has been introduced, enabling users to suggest the inclusion of new green crypto assets, enhancing the platform's comprehensiveness and community engagement.
4. **Database Expansion**: Our asset database has seen substantial growth, now boasting over 70 assets from 11 different providers, compared to the initial 26 assets from 8 providers. This expansion significantly broadens the scope of assets accessible to users.

[See the new prototype](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/)
[GitHub](https://github.com/Regen-Atlas/Regen-Atlas/tree/main)

[See the first prototype for comparison](https://www.ecofrontiers.app/)
[GitHub](https://github.com/unjoursurterre/Ecofrontiers-Map)

[See our proposal on the Celo Forum](https://forum.celo.org/t/draft-celo-public-goods-the-regen-atlas-louise-borreani/7738)

**The Green Crypto Handbook**

Beyond the technical advancements, our research and advocacy efforts have continued to flourish. After publishing the [chapter on green crypto-assets](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/zkh2LoADInAgr7GLbXnsuUOEcwJKFE4GuUSYuYU22io), as well as its [french translation](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/3WmaKoZkwGy-hpu64hB2Ky8BAMksVc19N3a2muAk52E), [Ecofrontiers](https://ecofrontiers.xyz/) has just released a [new sample chapter](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/z53KLf1agwjNSQrAY78Zg4qm9-FYZB2Yh3TDj3ojIRM) of its book, this one on **green crypto assets markets**. 

## Outputs üí™

The grant work will result in the following concrete outputs, from most to less likely depending on donations:

* Add additional assets and asset providers to the database.
* Make the buying of green crypto-assets possible directly through the Map interface.
* Start seeking potential partnerships for asset ratings.
* Hiring of a UX/UI designer to further work on the Atlas‚Äô design.
* Deployment of a public beta version of the Map on the Ecofrontiers website by July 2024.

## Resources üìö

üñ•Ô∏è [GitHub](https://github.com/Regen-Atlas/Regen-Atlas/tree/main)
üåê [Website](https://ecofrontiers.xyz/)
‚úíÔ∏è [Blog](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth)
üê¶ [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ecofrontiers)

## We thank you for your generosity! üôè
data.title: The Ecofrontiers Regen Atlas üå±
Regen Atlas üåç
data.description:
## TLDR ‚ú®

**Regen Atlas** grows green finance by coordinating its entire value chain on one single interface.

## üëÄ Vision

The climate crisis demands **trillions in funding**, yet traditional green finance remains inefficient. Current challenges include:

- **Low trust and accessibility** in green asset markets due to quality and reliability concerns.
- **Slow adoption** of green crypto assets compared to other sectors.
- **Heavy reliance on intermediaries**, reducing monetization and innovation.
- **Overemphasis on carbon offsets**, neglecting other critical green assets (e.g., biodiversity credits).
- **Lack of innovative financial instruments** (e.g., futures, indexes, nature-backed currencies) to drive liquidity.

‚û°Ô∏è **Regen Atlas is transforming this landscape** by providing an open-source platform for individuals and organizations to discover, trade, and access green crypto-assets. ‚¨ÖÔ∏è

## üó∫Ô∏è Solution: Regen Atlas

Regen Atlas is a **location-based green crypto-asset aggregator** that addresses market inefficiencies by consolidating **all existing green crypto assets** and their respective value chains.

### Key Features:

‚úÖ **Support for Diverse Green Assets** ‚Äì Access to a broad spectrum of green crypto assets, including biodiversity credits, agricultural tokens, green and blue bonds, and forward contracts.

‚úÖ **Aggregated Certifications** ‚Äì Ratings from multiple certifiers in one place, enabling users to assess asset quality and impact with confidence.

‚úÖ **Geo-Based Incentives** ‚Äì In the future, we would like users to be able to create incentives tied to specific locations, driving sustainable investment in high-impact areas.

## Resources üìö

üñ•Ô∏è [GitHub](https://github.com/Regen-Atlas/Regen-Atlas/tree/main)
üåê [Website](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/)
‚úíÔ∏è [Blog](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas)
üê¶ [Twitter](https://twitter.com/theregenatlas)

## We thank you for your generosity! üôè

### Key Features:

‚úÖ **Support for Diverse Green Assets** ‚Äì Access to a broad spectrum of green crypto assets, including biodiversity credits, agricultural tokens, green and blue bonds, and forward contracts.

data.missionSummary:
## üßë‚Äçüíª Roadmap & Future Plans

With your support, Regen Atlas will achieve the following milestones:

- üìå **Taxonomy Update** ‚Äì We are already working on a new asset classification that we aim to finish soon.
- üìä **Market Cap Statistics** ‚Äì Work has been started to provide users with real-time insights, and shall continue thanks to your support.
- üéã **Org Filter** ‚Äî Expanding beyond assets and issuers, our next major feature is an ‚ÄúOrgs Filter‚Äù, which will allow users to explore ReFi organizations (ReFi DAOs, GreenPill Networks, Celo DAOs).
- ‚ûï **More Assets & Providers** ‚Äì Continuously adding verified projects to the database.

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

Our project was selected to be part of the [GG20 Celo Public Goods Climate Bonus Round](https://mirror.xyz/celopg.eth/McicejfzasLM0nD5HKNdPukgQHvVrRVT2GiFwwzf8AA).


### **Celo Claim:**

Your project is actively developing a dApp to be deployed on the Celo Network., Your project has produced research, media or other resources that support the Celo ecosystem.

dApp Development on Celo: Ecofrontiers is actively developing the Regen Atlas, a location-based platform intended for deployment on the Celo Network. This dApp aims to provide a global, open-source platform to facilitate the discovery, funding, and creation of tokenized green assets. The Regen Atlas team recently received a Prezenti grant to support the UX/UI development of the interface, and enable direct buying of the assets on Celo.

Research Supporting Celo: Ecofrontiers has engaged in research efforts that support and advocate for the Celo ecosystem. A notable example is the release of chapters from the Green Crypto Handbook, which provides insights into how environmental finance can be structured within a Web3 context. Of note is that the two authors of the Green Crypto Handbook also wrote in the past core research and documentation for the Kolektivo Framework, a key project of the Celo ecosystem.

Place minimum three new green asset providers, focusing on the Celo ecosystem.

# The Ecofrontiers Regen Atlas üå±

## TLDR ‚ú®

[Ecofrontiers](https://ecofrontiers.xyz/) is a Web3 research and advocacy program to unlock the value of nature. Next to the writing of a book on the production of tokenized natural capital, Ecofrontiers has incubated **the Regen Atlas** (prev. the Ecofrontiers Map), an open-source platform designed to facilitate displaying, funding, and incubating of natural capital projects through a user-friendly, interactive map interface. 

**With this GG20 round, Ecofrontiers announces the release of a [new sample chapter](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/z53KLf1agwjNSQrAY78Zg4qm9-FYZB2Yh3TDj3ojIRM) of the Green Crypto Handbook, as well as a [new prototype](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/) of the Regen Atlas.**

## Vision üåç

The Regen Atlas is set to transform this landscape by providing a global, open-source platform for individuals and organizations to support or invest in environmental projects, equipped with detailed ratings for various green assets. This initiative not only diversifies the focus beyond carbon offsets to include other green assets like biodiversity and water purification but also introduces innovative financial instruments such as green bonds and nature-backed currencies.

## Solution: The Regen Atlas üó∫Ô∏è

[The Regen Atlas](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/) is a location-based aggregation layer enabling the discovery, trade, and creation of tokenized green assets throughout the globe.
With the Regen Atlas, we propose an alternative to the current state of the decentralized green asset market, where:
* Projects tokenizing natural capital are in need of a clear and intuitive platform to display the location of their assets.
* Organizations, governments and individuals willing to buy tokenized natural capital are in need of a unified interface enabling asset discovery beyond carbon.
* Environmental projects aiming to tokenize natural capital are in need of a platform to show where they are operating and advertise their project.

The Atlas‚Äô key features include:
**Support for Diverse Green Assets**: The Regen Atlas accommodates a wide array of green crypto-assets, covering various environmental categories that go beyond carbon. Users can explore and engage with projects related to carbon assets, but also non-carbon ecosystem services (e.g. biodiversity, regenerative agriculture, water purification), green and blue bonds, forwards contracts, and more. The interface has a filtering feature, enabling hassle-free browsing and funding. 
**Aggregated Ratings Agencies**: To provide users with valuable insights, the Regen Atlas is working towards aggregating scores from ratings agencies specializing in natural capital. This consolidated resource will offer a bird's eye view of the highest quality initiatives, helping potential funders make informed decisions while building their green portfolio. This round will help fund this feature.
**Top-down Territorial Incentives (longer term, outside the scope of this round)**: The Regen Atlas lets users create incentives in relation to extant territories, helping stimulate natural capital projects in areas where they can have the most significant impact. Users eager to incentivize the production of natural capital assets will be able to pin a location on the map and enter specific tender information‚Äîsuch as the incentive offered, e.g. a carbon credit‚Äîbefore publishing their request for proposals.
**Support for Existing Green Assets (longer term, outside the scope of this round)**: Many green assets already exist, but lack the global accessibility afforded by public blockchains. The interface will allow users to request these assets as tokens on Celo, partnering with well-regulated, designated RWA providers.

## What has been done since the last round üßë‚Äçüíª

Since our last update, the team has made significant progress on the [Regen Atlas prototype](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/), evolving it into a more refined and user-friendly version. We transitioned to a Version 2, which features a visually appealing design and enhanced user interface, making navigation and interaction with the platform more intuitive. Among the key improvements:

Enhanced Design and UI: The interface has been overhauled for better usability and aesthetic appeal.
Advanced Filtering Options: Users can now filter assets not just by their type and issuer, as before, but also by subtypes and location, allowing for a more granular search experience.
Asset Addition Feature: A new "add asset" function has been introduced, enabling users to suggest the inclusion of new green crypto assets, enhancing the platform's comprehensiveness and community engagement.
Database Expansion: Our asset database has seen substantial growth, now boasting over 70 assets from 11 different providers, compared to the initial 26 assets from 8 providers. This expansion significantly broadens the scope of assets accessible to users.

[See the new prototype](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/)
[GitHub](https://github.com/Regen-Atlas/Regen-Atlas/tree/main)

## Outputs üí™

The grant work will result in the following concrete outputs, from most to less likely depending on donations:
* Add additional assets and asset providers to the database.
* Make the buying of green crypto-assets possible directly through the Map interface.
* Start seeking potential partnerships for asset ratings.
* Hiring of a UX/UI designer to further work on the Atlas‚Äô design.
* Deployment of a public beta version of the Map on the Ecofrontiers website by July 2024.

## Resources üìö

üñ•Ô∏è [GitHub](https://github.com/Regen-Atlas/Regen-Atlas/tree/main)
üåê [Website](https://ecofrontiers.xyz/)

data.text:
Since our last update, the Regen Atlas has [spinned out of Ecofrontiers](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/O-xRxzyzAd-z2ST4gXvfcfqDGdG6dG9pc1xV1tlfDOA), the team has expanded, and made significant progress on the [Regen Atlas prototype v2](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/), evolving it into a more refined and user-friendly version. We‚Äôre just a few weeks away from releasing our Prototype v3, which includes a major update to our database, as well as a brand new UI and interface design. Other key updates include:

1. **Team Expansion**: The Regen Atlas now counts five members working together for the future of green finance.
2. **Enhanced Design and UI**: The interface of prototype v2 has been overhauled for better usability and aesthetic appeal. There‚Äôs now a new feature to filter assets by chain.
3. **Database Expansion**: Our asset database has seen substantial growth, now boasting over 109 assets from 18 different providers, compared to the initial 26 assets from 8 providers of prototype v1. We‚Äôre receiving new listing demands every week.
4. **New logo**: We worked with a designer to create our new logo and visual identity.
5. **New Partnerships**: The Regen Atlas is joining forces with LandX to list all of their farms producing xTokens. Learn more about this partnership [here](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas/regen-atlas-partners-with-landx)
6. **Speaking at EthCC[7]**: The Regen Atlas‚Äô team was in Brussels this year, attending and speaking at some key events, from the main conference to the Regen Village, or the Blockchain For Good Unconference. (Re)watch our EthCC talk [here](https://ethcc.io/archive/The-Regen-Atlas-Green-RWA-Tokenization)

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

## TLDR ‚ú®

**Regen Atlas** grows green finance by coordinating its entire value chain on one global marketplace.

**For this GG21 round, the Regen Atlas introduces a new design of [its prototype v2](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/), a database extension, new partnerships, and more**

## Vision üëÄ

The climate crisis requires trillions in funding that is not being spent today. Traditional methods for producing and trading green assets often lead to issues with quality and reliability, reducing trust and effectiveness. Global participation in trading green crypto assets remains low compared to other sectors, and outdated processes with heavy reliance on intermediaries hinder monetization and innovation. The current industry focus on carbon offsets overlooks other vital green assets like biodiversity credits. Finally, there is a pressing need for innovative financial instruments, such as futures, indexes, and nature-backed currencies, to effectively drive market liquidity.

‚û°Ô∏è **The Regen Atlas is set to transform this landscape by providing a global, open-source platform for individuals and organizations to support or invest in environmental projects.** ‚¨ÖÔ∏è

## Solution: The Regen Atlas üó∫Ô∏è

The Regen Atlas is a location-based green crypto-asset marketplace designed to address market inefficiencies by displaying all existing green crypto assets and aggregating their entire value chain (i.e. issuers, tokenizers, certifiers, raters, regulators, buyers). Specifically, the platform aims to offer:

1. **Support for Diverse Green Assets**: The number of green crypto-assets has been constantly growing over the last years. On the Regen Atlas, users have access to a broad spectrum of green crypto-assets (and soon corresponding stakeholders) that go beyond just carbon assets, including but not limited to biodiversity, agriculture, green and blue bonds, and forwards contracts. 
2. **Aggregated Certifications**: The platform will compile and display ratings from specialized certifiers, offering users a centralized resource for assessing the quality and potential impact of various environmental projects. Aggregation will empower users with the information necessary to make informed decisions around green assets.
3. **Top-down Territorial Incentives**: As a geo-interface, the Regen Atlas plans to allow users to create and publish incentives tied to specific geographic locations, developing natural capital in the most impactful areas
4. **Support for Existing Green Assets**: In the future, the platform will enable the tokenization of existing green assets on the blockchain, making them more accessible and tradable. 

## What has been done since the last round ‚úÖ üí™

Since our last update, the Regen Atlas has [spinned out of Ecofrontiers](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/O-xRxzyzAd-z2ST4gXvfcfqDGdG6dG9pc1xV1tlfDOA), the team has expanded, and made significant progress on the [Regen Atlas prototype v2](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/), evolving it into a more refined and user-friendly version. We‚Äôre just a few weeks away from releasing our Prototype v3, which includes a major update to our database, as well as a brand new UI and interface design. Other key updates include:

1. **Team Expansion**: The Regen Atlas now counts five members working together for the future of green finance.
2. **Enhanced Design and UI**: The interface of prototype v2 has been overhauled for better usability and aesthetic appeal. There‚Äôs now a new feature to filter assets by chain.
3. **Database Expansion**: Our asset database has seen substantial growth, now boasting over 109 assets from 18 different providers, compared to the initial 26 assets from 8 providers of prototype v1. We‚Äôre receiving new listing demands every week.
4. **New logo**: We worked with a designer to create our new logo and visual identity.
5. **New Partnerships**: The Regen Atlas is joining forces with LandX to list all of their farms producing xTokens. Learn more about this partnership [here](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas/regen-atlas-partners-with-landx)
6. **Speaking at EthCC[7]**: The Regen Atlas‚Äô team was in Brussels this year, attending and speaking at some key events, from the main conference to the Regen Village, or the Blockchain For Good Unconference. (Re)watch our EthCC talk [here](https://ethcc.io/archive/The-Regen-Atlas-Green-RWA-Tokenization)

## Outputs üßë‚Äçüíª

A lot is happening lately, and the Regen Atlas team is planning some major releases (prototype v3 almost out of the door, serious MVP planning, listings in the pipeline‚Ä¶). Contributions to this GG21 will directly support those major milestones ahead.

Grant work will result in the following concrete outputs, from most to less likely depending on donations:

* Add additional green assets and providers to the database.
* Launch the v3 UI, which includes Certifiers: a special stakeholder group in green assets that evaluate the quality of the assets.
* Secure and complete additional partnerships like the recent [LandX one](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas/regen-atlas-partners-with-landx).
* Pay for a part-time communication / growth manager to develop the Atlas‚Äô listings, including upcoming listings for Certifiers.
* Deployment of an MVP by EoY that can support up to 100k assets simultaneously.

## Resources üìö

üñ•Ô∏è [GitHub](https://github.com/Regen-Atlas/Regen-Atlas/tree/main)
üåê [Website](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/)
‚úíÔ∏è [Blog](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas)
üê¶ [Twitter](https://twitter.com/theregenatlas)

## We thank you for your generosity! üôè

questions.query: How should the success of your grant be measured?
questions.explanation: New projects added to the database, new partnerships secured, number of green crypto-assets purchased through the interface.

questions.query: What is the intended direct impact your project will have on the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: The Regen Atlas is a location-based green crypto-asset marketplace designed to address market inefficiencies by displaying all existing green crypto assets and aggregating their entire value chain (i.e. issuers, tokenizers, certifiers, raters, regulators, buyers). The project is set to transform the climate finance landscape by providing a global, open-source platform for individuals and organizations to support or invest in environmental projects. It notably aims to list all green crypto-assets live on Arbitrum.

questions.query: What is the long-term impact of your grant?
questions.explanation: A lot is happening lately, and the Regen Atlas team is planning some major releases (prototype v3 almost out of the door, serious MVP planning, listings in the pipeline‚Ä¶). Contributions to this GG21 will directly support those major milestones ahead.

questions.query: How will the grant funds be used?
questions.explanation: Pay for software. Hire contractors such as part-time comms / growth manager, designer, back-end dev.

questions.query: What is the timeframe for the work funded?
questions.explanation: 4 months (till EoY)

questions.query: How will receiving a grant enable you to foster growth or innovation within the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: The grant will enable the Regen Atlas to hire contractors to grow the project further, establish more partnerships (which are core to aggregation projects). Currently, we are receiving so much listing demands for the Atlas that we (the four founders, working full-time on the project) can't handle them all in parallel to building.

questions.query: Impact statement - what real world problem do you solve and how
questions.explanation:
The climate crisis requires trillions in funding that is not being spent today. Traditional methods for producing and trading green assets often lead to issues with quality and reliability, reducing trust and effectiveness. Global participation in trading green crypto assets remains low compared to other sectors, and outdated processes with heavy reliance on intermediaries hinder monetization and innovation. The current industry focus on carbon offsets overlooks other vital green assets like biodiversity credits. Finally, there is a pressing need for innovative financial instruments, such as futures, indexes, and nature-backed currencies, to effectively drive market liquidity.

The Regen Atlas is set to transform this landscape by providing a global, open-source platform for individuals and organizations to support or invest in environmental projects.

questions.query: Celo leverage - how does your project contributed to the Celo ecosystem?
questions.explanation: The Regen Atlas lists dozens of green crypto-assets live on Celo, and is working to enable direct buying of those assets on Celo through the interface.

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: GG20, GG21

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Open-source software must be connected to the real-world in order for its ecosystem to grow. The Regen Atlas, by providing an open-source overview of all of the green tokenized assets that exist, kills two birds with one stone: first, by practicing what it preaches and developing itself in an OSS fashion, and secondly, by illuminating for real-world communities the powerful OSS applications built on blockchain that can benefit them and their material environments. This is a strong pull factor for recruiting and expanding the OSS pie.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
The Regen Atlas handles the following use cases:


- Listing of green crypto-assets (and a custom, modernized taxonomy of green crypto) in a geo-interface, whose real-world properties is uncommon in Web3 development.
- Decentralized purchase of green crypto-assets on the Celo blockchain (to be expanded to more blockchains)
- Aggregation of certifications for green crypto-assets (more on this in the next question.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: Our next most pressing objective is to add Certifiers to the green crypto-assets on the Regen Atlas. Certifiers represent a group of stakeholders who give assets certifications by verifying their material impact in the world. Carbon credits have Certifications like Redd+ that attest to the quality of the carbon vintage. Similarly, sustainable tokenized commodities could have an organic certification that acknowledges them as being produced in a regenerative, non-chemical way.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Open-source software must be connected to the real-world in order for its ecosystem to grow. The Regen Atlas, by providing an open-source overview of all of the green tokenized assets that exist, kills two birds with one stone: first, by practicing what it preaches and developing itself in an OSS fashion, and secondly, by illuminating for real-world communities the powerful OSS applications built on blockchain that can benefit them and their material environments. This is a strong pull factor for recruiting and expanding the OSS pie.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
The Regen Atlas handles the following use cases:

- Listing of green crypto-assets (and a custom, modernized taxonomy of green crypto) in a geo-interface, whose real-world properties is uncommon in Web3 development.
- Aggregation of certifications for green crypto-assets. Certifiers represent a group of stakeholders who give assets certifications by verifying their material impact in the world. Carbon credits have Certifications like Redd+ that attest to the quality of the carbon vintage. Similarly, sustainable tokenized commodities could have an organic certification that acknowledges them as being produced in a regenerative, non-chemical way.
- Decentralized purchase of green crypto-assets on the Celo blockchain (to be expanded to more blockchains)

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
There are three critical milestones that are part of our next sprint:

1. Rehauling our Taxonomy

The current Regen Atlas green crypto-asset taxonomy is somewhat dated given innovation in the sector and our evolving understanding of green finance nomenclature. With proceeds from this round, we will update the taxonomy and all corresponding database entries in our aggregator.

2. A Green Crypto-Asset Market Metrics Dashboard


Work has already begun on this project. Essentially, we are building a dashboard to track the growth of green crypto-assets in real-time, using our database as reference and plugging into existing APIs such as Coingecko. By tracking the market size of the green crypto-asset sector, we can prove real growth and help drive investment towards it.

3. Addition of Organizations

Recently, there has been an explosion in projects leveraging Web3 to do regenerative and sustainable work, such as Celo Regional DAOs, Greenpill Network and ReFi DAO chapters, and more. We plan to add all of these Orgs and their respective nodes to the Regen Atlas, to better understack the growing Web3 localist ecosystem.

questions.query: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
- üè´ **Higher Fidelity Org Pages** ‚Äì We aim to dramatically improve the Orgs panel to provide a comprehensive aggregation service for Orgs in the Regenerative Finance ecosystem.

- üìå **Taxonomy Update** ‚Äì We are already working on a new asset classification that we aim to finish soon. This updated classification streamlines the current taxonomy to be more intuitive and aligned with the evolving industry of impact reporting.

- üìä **Market Cap Dashboard** ‚Äì Work has been started to provide users with real-time insights into market statistics based on the updated taxonomy, and shall continue thanks to your support.  With this, we‚Äôll be able to track the growth of the ReFi sector.

- ‚ûï **More Assets & Providers** ‚Äì Continuously adding verified projects to the database.

- üì∫ **UX/UI Improvements** ‚Äì With the rapid growth of the ReFi sector, we've pinned many green assets and orgs to the Regen Atlas. Now, we need to clean up the pins, and differentiate them in a way that is easily understandable for the user.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin‚Äôs backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

milestones.title: Token Engineering the Superchain G23 Update
milestones.description:
Since our previous application to Token Engineering the Superchain (see: https://beta.checker.gitcoin.co/view/application/%20%20%20%2010/57/40), we have accomplished much of the roadmap we originally stated. 

Namely:

- The Regen Atlas now displays **Certifiers and Certifications** for all listed green crypto-assets, helping bring transparency to existing green assets.

- We have created and enforced standardized metrics and criteria for listing and delisting of green crypto-assets **that support an issuance framework for green crypto-assets that optimizes for public, open-source production.**  (see: https://regen-atlas.gitbook.io/regen-atlas-docs/participate/listings)

- The Regen Atlas displays many green assets on **Base** and the Superchain‚Äôs latest member, **Celo**. On Base we‚Äôve aggregated green crypto-asset issuers like the **SolarpunkDAO, Plural Energy, and Azos Finance.** On Celo, we have just about every green crypto-asset issuer.

- We have begun work on a public goods dashboard tracking the growth of the green crypto-asset market.

questions.query: Vision Statement and Impact: Describe the long-term vision of your project and its intended impact on the Optimism and broader Superchain ecosystem, including both qualitative and quantitative benefits
questions.explanation:
The Regen Atlas will impact the Optimism ecosystem by:

Evolving Standards for the Production of Green Tokens: The Regen Atlas aims to broaden the scope of tokenized green assets available for exploration, trading, and funding. Our platform will support a diverse range of environmental assets beyond carbon, addressing a gap in the current market and providing a more comprehensive suite of options for users interested in environmental sustainability. Additionally, we aim to close the quality gap by aggregating certifiers of material claims for green tokens, building a competitive marketplace for certification where any service provider can provide verifiable claims.

Enhancing its Real-world and Climate Awareness: The Regen Atlas distinguishes itself as a geographic aggregator for location-based crypto-assets produced by real-world communities. This specificity allows non-virtual communities to engage with the Superchain in a place-based manner that has thus far been underexplored by Web3.

questions.query: Initial Strategy: Outline a high-level strategy for how you will achieve your intended impact and key goals for the next 3-6 months
questions.explanation:
Grant work will result in the following concrete outputs, from most to less likely depending on donations:

* Add additional green assets and providers to the database.
* Launch the v3 UI, which includes Certifiers: a special stakeholder group in green assets that evaluate the quality of the assets.
* Secure and complete additional partnerships like the recent [LandX one](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas/regen-atlas-partners-with-landx)
* Pay for a part-time communication / growth manager to develop the Atlas‚Äô listings, including upcoming listings for Certifiers.
* Deployment of an MVP by EoY that can support up to 100k assets simultaneously.

questions.query: Team Expertise: Provide a brief summary on the team‚Äôs background and relevant expertise in token engineering and/or OP
questions.explanation:
1. [Louise](https://twitter.com/LBorreani) is leading research for the Atlas. Over the past three years, she has made significant contributions in ReFi through her in-depth research on the space, digital Measurement, Reporting, and Verification (dMRV), nature-based asset markets and environmental tokenomics, notably for the Kolektivo Framework. Beyond her involvement with the Regen Atlas, Louise is advising several regenerative DAOs, and writing a book on natural capital capital production with Ecofrontiers.

2. [Christoph](https://www.linkedin.com/in/christophwuensche/) is providing operations and business development support for the Atlas. Previously, he was the COO of Curve Labs, involving him in the management of the operations of several Web3 projects such as Kolektivo, Giza, or PrimeDAO. 

3. [Pawel](https://github.com/paweljanicki) is the CTO of the Regen Atlas. He is a seasoned full-stack developer with Web3 experience, and has contributed to greenfield projects and MVPs various startups and agencies. Notably, he has contributed to projects such as PrimeDAO, and Kolektivo.

4. [Pat](https://twitter.com/papa_raw) is providing a mix of product, strategy, and marketing services for the Atlas. He started his Web3 journey in 2018 as the Marketing Director of DAOstack, where he served as the pilot manager of the first functioning DAO on Ethereum. He then co-founded Curve Labs in 2020, a Web3 agency which incubated or worked with notable Web3 projects. Beyond the Regen Atlas, Pat is advising several regenerative DAOs, and writing a book on natural capital production as Ecofrontiers.

questions.query: Existing Work: Provide evidence of any existing work, such as prototypes, research papers, or previous projects. If you have already done work within OP/ Superchain, please include that here too
questions.explanation: https://www.regenatlas.xyz

questions.query: Returning grantees: If your project has received prior funding from the Token Engineering Grants Program, please describe the impact that funding has had on the project
questions.explanation:
Since our last update, the Regen Atlas has [spinned out of Ecofrontiers](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/O-xRxzyzAd-z2ST4gXvfcfqDGdG6dG9pc1xV1tlfDOA), the team has expanded, and made significant progress on the [Regen Atlas prototype v2](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/), evolving it into a more refined and user-friendly version. We‚Äôre just a few weeks away from releasing our Prototype v3, which includes a major update to our database, as well as a brand new UI and interface design. Other key updates include:

1. **Team Expansion**: The Regen Atlas now counts five members working together for the future of green finance.
2. **Enhanced Design and UI**: The interface of prototype v2 has been overhauled for better usability and aesthetic appeal. There‚Äôs now a new feature to filter assets by chain.
3. **Database Expansion**: Our asset database has seen substantial growth, now boasting over 109 assets from 18 different providers, compared to the initial 26 assets from 8 providers of prototype v1. We‚Äôre receiving new listing demands every week.
4. **New logo**: We worked with a designer to create our new logo and visual identity.
5. **New Partnerships**: The Regen Atlas is joining forces with LandX to list all of their farms producing xTokens. Learn more about this partnership [here](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas/regen-atlas-partners-with-landx)
6. **Speaking at EthCC[7]**: The Regen Atlas‚Äô team was in Brussels this year, attending and speaking at some key events, from the main conference to the Regen Village, or the Blockchain For Good Unconference. (Re)watch our EthCC talk [here](https://ethcc.io/archive/The-Regen-Atlas-Green-RWA-Tokenization)
